content:
july  

A guilty plea was entered in the case of a Chicago man charged with firing shots at a Charleston residence in October PERIOD



Marc D PERIOD Griffin  pleaded guilty to a charge of aggravated discharge of a firearm but has not yet been sentenced PERIOD

Griffin pled guilty to firing about a halfdozen shots at a house located at  twelfth St PERIOD on the night of Oct PERIOD   PERIOD Griffin allegedly had a dispute with some of the occupants PERIOD

Assistant States Attorney Duane Deters gave an overview Wednesday of the evidence that would have been presented against Griffin had the case gone to trial PERIOD

Crystal P PERIOD Lovemore  of Chicago was also charged in connection with the shooting PERIOD Lovemore was an Eastern student at the time and allegedly enlisted Griffins help in solving a dispute she had with one of the houses occupants PERIOD

However Lovemores charges were dismissed after a witness refused to testify PERIOD

The sentencing hearing is scheduled for Sept PERIOD  with Circuit Judge Mitchell Shick presiding PERIOD Aggravated discharge of a firearm can be punishable by four to  years in prison or a maximum of four years probation PERIOD
